intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: I'd like to believe it's our cunning that got us this far without being spotted... But we've seen far too little of the Plegian Guard. Where are they? Whatever trap Gangrel has planned, he is in no hurry to spring it.

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: Milord, our scouts report some manner of engagement downfield.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Understood. Get everyone ready to move.

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: These desert sands are certain to bog down our units, milord. Only mages and fliers will likely be able to proceed unhindered.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Good point. I'll keep it in mind. Robin, let's discuss strategy.

battle.speaker: Nowi
battle.line: *Huff, huff* Have... Have I lost him?

battle.speaker: Gregor
battle.line: Wait, I say! Why you no comprehending, wee one?

battle.speaker: Nowi
battle.line: AUGH! GET AWAY! Everyone just leave me ALONE!

battle.speaker: Gregor
battle.line: Please, be keeping down with the voice! You give away position! Very bad!

battle.speaker: Nowi
battle.line: My throat is dry, my shoes are full of sand, and some big weirdo is trying to KILL ME!

battle.speaker: Gregor
battle.line: Oy, you break Gregor's heart! Why you treat like villain?

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: You there! Fiend! Keep your hands off that maiden!

battle.speaker: Gregor
battle.line: Who is fiend? ...You mean Gregor? No, friend! You have idea wrong!

battle.speaker: Lissa
battle.line: Yeah, right! ...Creep!

battle.speaker: Gregor
battle.line: This day has been nothing but insults and punches to groin. And all for doing good deed! ...Listen, friend! Gregor only want to—

battle.speaker: Chalard
battle.line: Gotcha, you slippery scamp! Prepare for a dose of Grima's wrath.

battle.speaker: Gregor
battle.line: Oy, this is most terrible! Do you see now? They make with the catching of us!

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: Why are you all after the girl?

battle.speaker: Gregor
battle.line: All? What is this "all"? Gregor is not one of "all"! Look close! Maybe you not see from so far? Gregor have innocent-baby face!

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: Hmm…

battle.speaker: Lissa
battle.line: Well…

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: Yeah... Not sure "innocent baby" is how I'd describe it…

battle.speaker: Gregor
battle.line: Gah! Never be minding! Gregor is not enemy! You must believe!

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: ...This is making my head hurt. We'll sort him out later. Right now, we need to protect the girl.

battle.speaker: Nowi
battle.line: Y-you're going to help me?

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: We'll do everything in our power to keep you safe. Just hold on until we can reach you, and we'll drive them off!

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: We need to warn these villages of the danger. But who to send? Best if it's someone who can move swiftly through the sands...

battle.speaker: Nowi
battle.line: GET AWAY FROM ME!

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: What in blazes?! The girl is a dragon!

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: By the gods, she's a manakete... I never thought I'd see one.

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: Hmm... Perhaps she doesn't need our help so much as we could use hers...

character-falls.speaker: Nowi
character-falls.line: Nngh... That h-hurts! I have to get to...safety...

boss.speaker: Chalard
boss.line: Ha ha! You dare defy Grima, god of annihilation?

visit.speaker: Elder
visit.line: Gods praise ye, good people! Gods praise ye one and all! We lives in constant fear of what the Grimleal will do to us, so we does! 'Ere! Take this staff with me blessings! It can fetch distant comrades to safety. Be sure to place it in the hands o' one gifted in spells or the like. Magic folk be able to reach the farthest with it!

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: You have our thanks for the warning. Please, take this. It's my family's treasure. I would offer more, if only I could. A fellow with enough experience could use it to grow even stronger.

visit.speaker: Maiden
visit.line: Really? You'll protect the village? ...This little dung heap? Goodness, you're kind! I suppose I should give you a little something, eh? ...Here. Someone with enough experience could use this to start a new life. It's like running off to join a circus troupe! ...But more classy-like.

end.speaker: Nowi
end.line: This is just the worst. Day. EVER! *sob!*

end.speaker: Gregor
end.line: Ho now, wee one! Do not make with the crying of tears. The evil people are now dead people. This is good, no?

end.speaker: Nowi
end.line: You... You're right. Th-thank you. And... I'm sorry I was so mean to you earlier. I just get nervous around people who are...outside my age group.

end.speaker: Gregor
end.line: Your age group? Ha! Gregor much closer to your age than others here!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Say, um...Gregor, was it? Gregor, do you mind looking after her? We need to press on.

end.speaker: Gregor
end.line: Mmm... Gregor is mercenary, yes? Maybe you hire Gregor instead. True, Gregor just finish killing former employers, but still very reliable! So long as you not try to hurt little girl, Gregor will not hurt you. Also, Gregor need steady income. ...Many angry former employers.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: You're a sellsword?

end.speaker: Gregor
end.line: Yes! Very swell sword! Cost performance very high. You have Gregor's word.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Sure, why not? You're hired.

end.speaker: Nowi
end.line: But! But what about me?! I WON'T go back on the auction block!

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Wait. You've been sold? Like a...like a slave?!

end.speaker: Nowi
end.line: To men more despicable than you can possibly imagine. They made me transform for them... They drank and laughed and called out tricks…

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: What kind of scumbags buy and sell a little girl?! Even if she CAN turn into a dragon…

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: She may be little, milady, but not nearly so young as you might think. Manaketes live a very long time.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Really? ...How old are you?

end.speaker: Nowi
end.line: Oh, I dunno. ...A thousand...something? But look! No wrinkles!

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: The dragonkin are said to be more resilient than men. Nowi would make a strong ally. Besides, we cannot risk her falling back into the hands of the Grimleal.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Beg pardon, but who are the Grimleal?

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: Followers of the fell dragon, Grima. The selfsame dragon the first exalt defeated a thousand years ago. Even today there are some who yearn for the fiend's return.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: I...see.

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: Well, shall we get some rest? We're almost to the Plegian capital. We'll need all our strength, soon enough…
